revised_title: The Barometrical Method of Measuring Mountain Heights: A Review of John James Scheuchzer's Observations
tldr: The author reviews the historical methods of measuring mountain heights, focusing on the barometrical method developed by John James Scheuchzer. He discusses the limitations of previous methods, such as trigonometry, and highlights the advantages of the barometrical method, which is based on the pressure and gravity of the air. The author also provides an overview of the development of barometric tables and their applications in determining the heights of places.
